required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: TEAS to Improve Outcome During Emergence From General Anesthesia After Robotic Surgery
clinical_study.official_title: Effect of Transcutaneous Electrical Acupoint Stimulation on Outcome During Emergence From Anesthesia in Patients Undergoing Robotic Laparoscopic Gynecologic Surgery

brief_summary.textblock: This study is to observe whether transcutaneous electrical stimulation at specific acupoints could improve the quality of emergence in patients undergoing robotic laparoscopic gynecologic surgery.

detailed_description.textblock: During robotic laparoscopic gynecologic surgery, the patients are put in an extremely trendelenburg positon. And a long duration of this position could lead to delayed emergence or agitation. Stimulation at some acupoints were reported to improve homeostasis. In this study we tend to observe whether transcutaneous electrical stimulation at specific acupoints could improve the quality of emergence in patients undergoing robotic laparoscopic gynecologic surgery.

primary_outcome.time_frame: from end of inhaling sevoflurane to departing from postanesthesia care unit(PACU),an anticipated average of 1 hour
primary_outcome.description: time to open eyes to verbal command

secondary_outcome.time_frame: from end of inhaling sevoflurane to departing from PACU,an anticipated average of 1 hour
secondary_outcome.description: status of the patients during emergence

secondary_outcome.time_frame: from end of inhaling sevoflurane to departing from PACU,an anticipated average of 1 hour
from end of inhaling sevoflurane to 24h after surgery,an anticipated average of 24 hour
secondary_outcome.description: Score of quality of recovery using a 15 items questionaire

secondary_outcome.time_frame: from arriving at PACU to departing from PACU,an anticipated average of 30min
from arriving at PACU to departing from PACU,an anticipated average of 30min
secondary_outcome.description: postoperative nausea and vomiting in the PACU

secondary_outcome.time_frame: from arriving at PACU to departing from PACU,an anticipated average of 30min
secondary_outcome.description: visual analogue score of pain in the PACU, scored 0-10

secondary_outcome.time_frame: from before anesthesia to after surgery, an anticipated average of 4 hours
secondary_outcome.description: level of serum Aquaporin 4 before anesthesia and at the end of the surgery

secondary_outcome.time_frame: from before anesthesia to after surgery, an anticipated average of 4 hours
secondary_outcome.description: level of serum Matrix metallop roteinase before anesthesia and at the end of the surgery

secondary_outcome.time_frame: from before anesthesia to after surgery, an anticipated average of 4 hours
secondary_outcome.description: level of serum S100β before anesthesia and at the end of the surgery

arm_group.description: Electrical stimulation is given through electrodes attached to acupoints
Electrical stimulation is given through electrodes attached to non-acupoints
Electrode attached but no stimulation is given

intervention.description: electrical stimulation is given through electrodes attached to th skin

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients scheduled for robotic laparoscopic gynecologic surgery under general anesthesia
- Patients with written informed consent
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients with difficulty in communication
- Patients with disease of central nervous system

results_reference.citation: Schramm P, Treiber AH, Berres M, Pestel G, Engelhard K, Werner C, Closhen D. Time course of cerebrovascular autoregulation during extreme Trendelenburg position for robotic-assisted prostatic surgery. Anaesthesia. 2014 Jan;69(1):58-63. doi: 10.1111/anae.12477. Epub 2013 Nov 20.

Pandey R, Garg R, Darlong V, Punj J, Chandralekha, Kumar A. Unpredicted neurological complications after robotic laparoscopic radical cystectomy and ileal conduit formation in steep trendelenburg position: two case reports. Acta Anaesthesiol Belg. 2010;61(3):163-6.
